intro: Gonocarpus jacquinii, commonly known as the yellow mangrove, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its ability to thrive in saline and brackish water environments. The plant has a distinctive appearance with smooth, waxy leaves and yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters. It plays an important ecological role in stabilizing coastal soils and providing habitat for various marine and terrestrial species. Gonocarpus jacquinii is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal remedies.
